page.title: 03OIL PIPELINES
page.content:
Another feature which we thought would cause a lot of concern was the laying of a large oil pipeline through the area. However, no one seemedto mind as those affected had been paid compensation and great care has been taken to restore the land to its original appearance.
There are some more general concerns. The area has very narrow roads and so farm traffic and cars do not always mix well. At times of hay and silage making and harvest time some people are disturbed by the noise of machinery and by the blowing of dust and straw into their gardens. Also, in some areas where pigs are kept flies are attracted which upsets some people.
